intro: Selinum tenuissimum, commonly known as slender wormwood, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and aromatic properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
